reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Enhanced Integrated Framework (EIF) for trade-related assistance to LDCs

description.narrative: Enhanced Integrated Framework (EIF) is a global partnership between the Least Development Countries (LDCs) donors and international organizations whose objective is to support LDCs to benefit from international trade in order to advance sustainable economi c growth create employment and reduce poverty. EIF builds the capacity of trade ministries and strengthens their cooperation with other actors drafts a roadmap for partner countries to enhance trade potential helps to integrate trade into national developm ent strategies acts as an Aid for Trade coordinator at the country level as well as provides seed funding to projects with substantial trade potential. EIF is explicitly mentioned in SDG Target 8.A.The role of EIF in supporting the development of the trade sector of LDCs and integration of LDCs into the global economy is fundamental. Many developing countries particularly the poorest ones have not been able to benefit from the opportunities offered by international trade. Their economies are fragile and und iversified employment opportunities are chronically in short supply and the economies are not in a position to provide adequate welfare for the people. Trade authorities lack strong capacity trade is not treated as a key pillar of development and the donor s' activities are uncoordinated at the country level.The immediate beneficiaries include trade ministries and trade authorities whose capacity increases. The other beneficiaries include trading enterprises whose trade values and number of jobs increase as well as their employees and families. In addition the donors benefit from more efficient coordination at the country level. EIF has helped micro small and medium-sized enterprises in LDCs to develop trade is an integral part of national development strateg ies LDCs' trade has grown and become more diversified enterprises have created jobs and people have earned a living. EIF has also contributed strongly to women's entrepreneurship in the LDC countries in the form of Empower Women Power Trade initiative.Finl and has contributed ten million euros to EIF in 2016-2020. This one million euro additional contribution is for 2021.

EIF is explicitly mentioned in SDG Target 8.A.The role of EIF in supporting the development of the trade sector of LDCs and integration of LDCs into the global economy is fundamental. Many developing countries particularly the poorest ones have not been able to benefit from the opportunities offered by international trade. Their economies are fragile and und iversified employment opportunities are chronically in short supply and the economies are not in a position to provide adequate welfare for the people. The other beneficiaries include trading enterprises whose trade values and number of jobs increase as well as their employees and families. This one million euro additional contribution is for 2021.

tag.narrative: Generating jobs, livelihood opportunities and well-being in a developing country is the main prio rity area in this activity
Improving democracy in societies is a secondary priority area in this activity
